bibl.title: Aspects of the Preservation and Transmission of Indigenous Religious Traditions in Akhmim and Its Environs during the Graeco-Roman Period.
Perspectives on Panopolis: An Egyptian Town from Alexander the Great to the Arab Conquest. Acts from an International Symposium Held in Leiden on 16, 17 and 18 December 1998
bibl.author: SMITH, Mark

bibl.note: A brief survey of the evidence pertaining to Egyptian religion during the Graeco-Roman period from the Akhmim region. - Pp. 245-247: Postscript [about the survival of the pagan religious beliefs in Shenoute's time]. Critical observations on: David FRANKFURTER, Religion in Roman Egypt. Assimilation and Resistance (Princeton, 1998).
